Posted By: nemokara (9/23/2011 2:26:46 PM)

posts.post_content:
*DarthParallax: Find a way to create an infinite loop involving two of these. Extra props if the board state actually is crossing the beams.*   
  
So, dealing 8 damage to a hypothetical beefy creature with flying is the start of the loop. I can't work it out myself, but I'm sure a superior Johnny could work out the situation.   
  
A non-infinite version would be to have out a [True Conviction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=True Conviction), a [Sanguine Bond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sanguine Bond) out, [Wound Reflection](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wound Reflection), and cast [Ragged Veins](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ragged Veins) on an indestructible flier. Let's say our opponent is some wiseguy who gave a [Blightsteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blightsteel Colossus) flying somehow. One of these deals 4 damage to the Colossus and the player, you gain 4 life, and the Colossus' controller loses 4 life. Then, at the end of the turn, Wound Reflection doubles the 8 total lost life into 16. A second Geistcatcher's Rig entering the field pushes it up to a lethal 32.
posts.html:
DarthParallax: Find a way to create an infinite loop involving two of these. Extra props if the board state actually is crossing the beams.

So, dealing 8 damage to a hypothetical beefy creature with flying is the start of the loop. I can't work it out myself, but I'm sure a superior Johnny could work out the situation.

A non-infinite version would be to have out a True Conviction, a Sanguine Bond out, Wound Reflection, and cast Ragged Veins on an indestructible flier. Let's say our opponent is some wiseguy who gave a Blightsteel Colossus flying somehow. One of these deals 4 damage to the Colossus and the player, you gain 4 life, and the Colossus' controller loses 4 life. Then, at the end of the turn, Wound Reflection doubles the 8 total lost life into 16. A second Geistcatcher's Rig entering the field pushes it up to a lethal 32.
